reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Switzerland's largest Carnival (UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage). If Ash Wednesday is late Feb/early Mar, Fasnacht often occurs in early/mid-March. A 72-hour city-wide event with parades (Cortège), lanterns (Morgestraich), music (Guggenmusik), and unique traditions. A truly unforgettable, intense experience.
After Fasnacht concludes (or if it falls in Feb), March sees fewer crowds. Enjoy world-class museums like Kunstmuseum Basel, Fondation Beyeler, or Museum Tinguely with more space.
Benefit from generally lower prices for flights and accommodation compared to summer, *except* during Fasnacht week when prices are extremely high. Check for spikes if Easter falls late March.
Witness early spring flowers like crocuses and daffodils emerging in parks and along the Rhine. Late March might bring the first magnolia blooms in sheltered spots.
Unpredictable weather makes March perfect for exploring Basel's outstanding museums, art galleries, and cozying up in traditional cafes in the Altstadt.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: If visiting during Fasnacht, expect the city to be completely packed. Accommodation is scarce and exorbitantly priced (book months/years ahead). Many regular shops/businesses close during the 72-hour event.
March is known for volatile weather ('Märzwetter'): expect anything from sun to rain, wind, grey skies, even late snow/sleet, often changing rapidly. Temperatures fluctuate.
Average highs hover around 11-13°C (52-55°F), nights often near freezing. Wind can make it feel much colder, especially near the Rhine. Waterproof layers are essential.
Days lengthen significantly (approx. 11-13 hours daylight) but are still shorter than peak summer, impacting extensive outdoor plans.
If Easter falls late March, Good Friday/Easter Monday are public holidays. Expect widespread shop closures and reduced services.
Outside of Fasnacht's specific outdoor events, it's often too cold, wet, or windy for comfortable extended outdoor activities like picnics or Buvette lounging (most aren't open yet).

weather.precipitation: Highly variable: can see sun, cloud, rain showers, possibly sleet or wet snow. Can be windy.
weather.general_tips: Pack versatile layers: thermals, fleece, waterproof/windproof outer jacket, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots. Umbrella vital. *Crucially check Fasnacht dates for this period*.

tourism_level.crowds: *Extremely high* if Fasnacht falls during this period. Otherwise, relatively low season continues.
tourism_level.pricing: *Exorbitant* during Fasnacht week. Otherwise, generally good value shoulder season prices.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: *Completely dominated by Fasnacht* if dates align - intense, noisy, festive 24/7. Otherwise, a quiet late winter/early spring transition.

events_holidays.name: Basler Fasnacht (Potential Dates)
events_holidays.date: Starts Monday after Ash Wednesday (Check exact dates, often early/mid-March) M
events_holidays.description: The main event. Starts 4:00 AM Monday with Morgestraich. Continues 72 hours with Cortège parades (Mon/Wed afternoons), Guggenmusik concerts (Tues evening), Schnitzelbänke, lantern exhibitions.
events_holidays.notes: Requires extreme advance planning for accommodation. Buy the Fasnacht 'Plakette' (badge). Embrace chaos and confetti.

unique_experiences.description: Witness the magical, pitch-dark start of Fasnacht at 4 AM sharp, illuminated only by thousands of hand-painted lanterns carried by 'cliques' to the sound of piccolos and drums.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive by 3:30 AM. Dress extremely warmly. Absolutely no flash photography. A solemn, unique tradition.

unique_experiences.where: Designated parade route through city center
unique_experiences.description: See the large, colourful parades with elaborate floats ('Waggis'), costumed 'cliques', Guggenmusik bands, and showers of confetti ('Räppli'), oranges, and sweets.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Find a spot along the route early. Expect huge crowds and being covered in confetti. Wear old clothes.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Kunstmuseum Basel (if not Fasnacht)
unique_experiences.description: Explore Basel's premier art museum, housing Old Masters to contemporary art, enjoying fewer crowds if visiting outside Fasnacht week.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours. Check opening times (closed Mondays). Excellent indoor activity.

unique_experiences.description: Experience the loud, cacophonous, and energetic brass band music ('Guggenmusik') performed by numerous costumed groups, especially on Tuesday evening.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wander between squares. Very crowded and loud. Embrace the unique sound.

weather.precipitation: Still very changeable, but increasing chance of milder, sunnier spells. Rain showers remain common. Late snow rare but possible.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering, waterproofs essential. Enjoy longer daylight hours. Check for Easter dates and potential closures.

tourism_level.crowds: Generally low shoulder season unless Fasnacht runs into this period or Easter falls late. Much quieter than Fasnacht week.
tourism_level.pricing: Good value typically, but check for Easter holiday spikes if applicable.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Clearer signs of spring emerge. Early flowers in bloom. City feels brighter and less wintry. Easter preparations might start if applicable.

events_holidays.name: Basler Fasnacht (Conclusion, if applicable)
events_holidays.description: If Fasnacht started earlier, it concludes 72 hours after the Morgestraich (i.e., Thursday 4:00 AM). City begins cleanup.
events_holidays.notes: Crowds dissipate quickly after Fasnacht ends.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: If Easter occurs: Good Friday & Easter Monday are public holidays. Look for Easter chocolates/decorations in shops. Special church services.
events_holidays.notes: Widespread shop closures Good Friday/Easter Monday. Check museum/attraction opening times.

events_holidays.name: Magnolia & Early Spring Blooms
events_holidays.description: Look for blooming magnolias, cherry blossoms, daffodils, and crocuses in parks (like Schützenmattpark) and gardens (Botanical Garden).
events_holidays.notes: A welcome sign of spring after winter.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the world-class modern and contemporary art collection in its serene park setting as spring arrives.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 2-3 hours plus travel. Check opening hours. Combine with a walk in the park to see early blooms.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a bracing walk along the Rhine, watching the river flow and spotting the first signs of spring greenery.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Dress warmly, can still be windy. Flat, easy walking. Longer daylight allows for later afternoon strolls.

unique_experiences.description: See the transition to spring with early bulbs blooming outdoors and explore the diverse plant collections in the greenhouses.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Greenhouses offer shelter if weather is poor.

unique_experiences.activity: Take a Fähri Across the Rhine
unique_experiences.where: Four crossing points in the city center
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a short, peaceful crossing on a traditional current-powered ferry as the city awakens for spring.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Small cash fee. Runs frequently during daylight. Offers nice city views from the water.
